Reviews.Title: Very good 720p picture quality - ONE YEAR Update
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: ***** 1 YEAR UPDATE: I hesitated to order a TV where I'd never heard of the brand name, so I did a little research beforehand. Sceptre has been in business since 1984 making PC monitors, so it only makes sense they know what they're doing - making a TV is not much different, but with the addition of a TV tuner card among other things. This TV is in a room where it picks up cat litter dust and still no problems.*****The screen is matte as well as the frame around the TV--it looks like matte black brushed aluminum, but it's plastic. The stand is glossy black. The picture quality is very good. The sound is decent if you choose something other than the default setting - one of the settings a graphic equalizer appears, and you have your choice of rock, pop, jazz, and user, where you choose your own settings on the slider bar. Just play with it a bit to find your personal preference.Plus:  Not one dead pixel...I scrutinized it carefully for hours.The 32" size is perfect for a bedroom; and it has a sleep timer, and it can be set to shut off at 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 90 and 120 minute intervals.Make sure you peel all the clear plastic off. Five screws in the bottom of the stand and you're finished. The stand doesn't wobble and feels secure enough as long as you don't have kids trying to hang off it. Sceptre also provides a screwdriver and a cleaning cloth.Two tiny complaints: 1. It would have been nice to have a back-lit remote control to see it easier in the dark; 2. The first week I had this, it had a funky plastic odor that I'd notice whenever I entered my bedroom, but I don't smell it now.NOTE:  You cannot use the USB for playing movies off a flash drive, etc.NOTE:  This can also be used as a computer monitor - it has the blue plug-in port for monitor to PC hook-up and the green port for the speaker hook-up. (But I personally didn't try it as a monitor, I only wanted a TV). It's there if you want it.If you're looking for an antenna, this is an excellent one:Paper Thin Leaf Indoor HDTV Antenna - Made in the USA! - Manufacturer Refurbished*****Also, see customer-uploaded images - I took a photo during DWTS showing the picture quality of the TV - and a photo showing the remote control up-close.

Reviews.Title: Awsome TV
Reviews.Author: daniesp7
Reviews.Content: I never take time to do reviews, but this time they deserve it:Good stuff:- LED (ultrathin)- Modern and cool black shiny design- Good contrast ratio (better than most)- Remote and menus very easy- 3xHDMI, etc...- PRICE!"Could be better" stuff:- Its not FULL HD, only 720p. Anyways I tried out 1080p movies and its simply amazing quality.- Headphone jack doesnt give out great quality (I really dont care because I wont use it)They know how to perform their brand touchpoints with the costumer. I opened it, everything was neatly packaged, with zip locker plastic bags, it included a nice screwdriver, and all the connections on the TV are labeled with color stickers with what they are (HDMI, PC, CABLE) so you dont have to go blind looking for it. Small details that make the difference!By the way it shipped super fast (with ordinary 3-5day shipping), ordered it on friday night and got it monday.Way to go for Amazon and Sceptre!!!

Reviews.Title: Worth the price
Reviews.Author: techman34
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical at first about buying a no name, fails cheap LED TV. I didn't think the tv would be great quality and I though there would be many problems. It was delivered on time, in perfect condition. Let me tell you, the TV looks absolutely great. It has a really thin border, and feels well built. The stand was easy to set up, and I got the TV working within 5 minutes. The picture quality honestly is pretty darn good. For a mere $209 32 inch LED tv, you can't ask for a better price than this. The picture quality was great, and sound was good. There were 3 channels that appeared to be signaling issues. Whether that is because of the tv or cable, I don't know. If you are like me, someone who wants a great looking tv, at a good size and amazing price, look no further. This will be well worth your money.

Reviews.Title: Decent For the Price
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Good picture, crappy sound, but I am using a home stereo amp for audio, so it's not much of an issue. Basic TV features, easy to use, with a shallow learning curve. The only real complaints I have, is that I was led to believe (based on everything I've read about it on the net) that this TV had a glossy piano black bezel. But instead, it is an ugly black wood grain. Also, every spec reference I've seen on the net says that this TV has a 6.5 ms response time. But the intructions that come with it says 8 ms, which is not as good. Might want to consider that if you intend to use it for video gaming. I don't play video games, so it's not that big a deal, but still misleading. I had to buy, and then wait for the TV to get here, to find out that the spec listed all over the net is bogus. Overall, I would probably buy it again, due to the reasonable price. Not likely to ever find a perfect TV for a rock-bottom price. So I am satisfied. But I don't see this TV as a 5 star TV, like most of the other reviews here. Decent for the money? Yes.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv for its price!
Reviews.Author: Sting Ray
Reviews.Content: I can not believe that i am able to purchase a good T.V for $223 bucks!. The picture quality is amazing. If you were to look from the side angles of the TV u can still see the picture quality perfectly without any blur. For the record, i do not understand why people say the sound quality is bad. I think the sound quality is good for a $200 dollar TV. If you expect to get a high end tv with that price range then your expectations are too dam high. I also have a 42inch LCD 1080p TV but i like the picture quality of this LED TV more. The side views like i mentioned before is not blurry and the picture quality is much brighter.As i write this review, i am hooking it up with to laptop. This tv has a better picture quality than my monitor!. Sceptre also specialize in computer monitors as well. No wonder they have such a good picture quality. Before discovering about Sceptre i was thinking of getting an Insignia 32 inch tv but the reviews werent buying it for me. After doing some research on this T.V and reading the other good reviews, i can say that i made a good decision. I needed a TV to play ps3 games and watch movies from my laptop. It simply gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: So far great TV
Reviews.Author: elric
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv for my kids room, picture looks great. The price unbeatable. Sound is pretty good to my ears. Win win for us.

Reviews.Title: Great till It got discolorization
Reviews.Author: JP Gui "Jay"
Reviews.Content: This LED TV was great till it got a discolorization issue on lower left portion of the screen just on top of the left speaker. A yellowish palm size discolorization appears after a week of using the unit. Amazon did replace it and had the replacement shipped right away.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Value For An LED TV
Reviews.Author: Sparrow
Reviews.Content: Finally decided it was time to take the HDTV plunge and replace our 15 year old, 19 inch Symphonic television. We put off purchasing an HDTV until the prices came down to a fixed price point we arbitrarily set years ago when they first came out.Our criteria for a new set: LED rather than LCD, thin profile, multiple inputs, $200 price point, and in the 32 inch size class.This set meets all of our criteria very well.Set was delivered in just 2 days thanks to our Prime membership. Setup was very quick an easy. I had downloaded the user manual ahead of time, and was able to use the information in the manual to cut out and weld up my own custom wall mount for the set. (Think hospital style wall mounting) Just 4 metric machine screws and the set was mounted and up on the wall.At time of order, we also purchased a couple of HDMI cables. A very short cable to plug into a Roku box that was mounted up on the wall with the TV and a long cable to connect our DVD player. Some older equipment is connected via the composite video and audio inputs.After a month of use, here are our observations.What we like:The picture is very sharp and crisp, with no lag at all during fast action scenes, a problem with some LCD sets.The sound is acceptable, with reasonable frequency response.Boot up time is short, and the set turns on to the last channel or input selected.The over the air TV tuner is sensitive and pulls in weak signals with ease. We're quite far from a metro area and still get many channels with our small, outdoor antenna.What we don't like:While the remote is intuitive, and easy to use by touch alone; There's a button sorely missing. Changing inputs can require up to 9 button presses. First you have to press the input button, then scroll down the list of available inputs. Next, after highlighting your choice, you need to press the select button. A single input select button that would cycle through all available would make this television perfect!Conclusion:For the price, this is a wonderful television that we've very pleased with. If we have occasion to purchase another of this size, we'll be buying another one of these.

Reviews.Title: Awesome cheap LED TV
Reviews.Author: Ch1cken
Reviews.Content: Great TV, especially for the price.  Bought one as a trial since you can't beat the price - how bad could it be? - for a kids room.  After using for a week or so, bought 2 more for the other bedrooms.  Highly recommended! At 32" you don't gain anything by going to 1080p.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Decent Little TV
Reviews.Author: JohnnyD
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my RV.  I think it's about the right size for my RV and it has a pretty good picture connected to my Panasonic BluRay.  I had a Vizio 22" Razor LED backlit that this one replaced and honestly I think the Vizio picture was a tad better but just too small for my application.  But the Vizio was 1080p and this unit is 720p.  I just watched a bit of Lord of the Rings on this unit and the picture quality is good.  I haven't done any tweaking yet.  I can already see that I want to do some adjusting on the colors but will save that for a camping night activity.  I think the TV is a good buy and worth the few hundred dollar price tag.  Only time will tell if it will last as I'm not familiar with name brand Sceptre but quality seems good.  The unit came nicely packed and even had a little screwdriver to connect the base and had screen cleaning pad.One thing to note.  DO NOT buy the wall mount that is combined with this TV on Amazon's section at the bottom that suggests you buy the mount.  It is the wrong size.  This TV has the wider VESA 400 x 200 size and the mount Amazon is adding to the bottom in the "add this to your order section" is only a VESA 200 x 200 size (too small).  I had to return mine and let Amazon know but I think were confused because the mount says it fits up to 37" TV, but that doesn't matter since the size of that mount does not fit the back of this TV.  Amazon has the right mount for $4 more.  Just make sure it fits VESA 400x200.

Reviews.Title: This TV needs MORE Good Reviews!
Reviews.Author: SAMMASH "HD_MAN"
Reviews.Content: I already had a great experience with a previous 720 LED Sceptre TV from Walmart.com, so I bought this one which is this year's model from Amazon since it was the best priced 32" LED 720P TV, and boy is it slim and pretty and colors look wonderful and picture is sharp. I am not concerned about sound althought it is more than good enough for my daughter's room. I had already ran electrical and AV wiring (HDMI/network) between her closet and the wall location where the TV was mounted and had already installed the electrical and AV outlets on both ends. So now, just like in my all other bedrooms I have her new 32" super SLIM LED TV mounted on the wall with no cables showing, and the display devices are a DirecTV receiver and a networked Sony BD player all hooked up through HDMI runs via the attic and through the walls. The TV looks very impressive and i wouldn't sweat the 720P versus 1080P resolution difference over a 32" TV, plus it will display an interlaced 1080 solution and it looks wonderful for a $200 TV which looks as good as the $500 ones. Buy with ease and confidence! This TV will be a top seller on Amazon very soon, it already has more than 1500 positive reviews on Walmart's website.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded Expectations
Reviews.Author: Picky Consumer
Reviews.Content: Although a little skeptical given the relatively unknown brand, I purchased this TV on Black Friday based on its exceptional reviews. Well, it has exceeded my expectations so far. The picture quality is outstanding, on par with Vizio and Samsung products I had considered. There were 0 dead pixels. The two issues most commonly listed as "cons" in the reviews I studied were poor sound quality and a finicky remote control. These are non-issues from my perspective. Sound quality is perfectly acceptable if not admirable for such small speakers in such a small enclosure, and the remote works just fine. I bought an RCA cable to connect the audio output to our stereo (anticipating inadequate sound) and never took it out of the package. I'm happy with the native sound from the TV. There are abundant outputs available too, more than other TV's I considered. You can hook this thing up to virtually anything so versatility is great. Don't sweat the 780p vice 1080p limitation either. I'm pretty picky about image quality and I can't tell any difference. Works great with streaming Netflix and old school DVD player too even though they are standard definition. I would have no problem recommending this product. Longevity is the only wild card that I cannot evaluate thus far but the warranty seems pretty good to cover that contingency too. Go for it. It seems its really earned its great reviews. Kudos to Sceptre, whoever you are!P.S. It showed up two days early! Thanks Amazon...

Reviews.Title: DOA Unit!!
Reviews.Author: William J. Clements
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my Daughter for Christmas, and it never worked out of the box.. Now I seem to not be able to exchange it, even though Amazon has others in stock, and the Manufacture wants me to buy a new TV and then send this one to them so they can look at it, and then return the newly bought TV and they can send me a different one... What!? To add to that, I purchased a warranty from Amazon and I have heard nothing back from them...Terribly Disappointed! Shame on you Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: Worth just as much as TVs double the price.
Reviews.Author: Amit
Reviews.Content: All I can say about this TV is "Wow."To start off, I just wanted to say I bought this TV simply because of the cheap price - roughly $210 at the time I bought it.Originally, when I saw this listing, I was like, "A 32 inch, $210 LED TV? There must be a catch." I read the other reviews, and I did not find any ridiculous "catches." So I swallowed my tongue and ordered the TV. Like I said, I'm a college student, low on cash, so I needed to take a risk with this cheap, no-named company, TV. Boy, was I surprised after I received it. First of all, the TV itself took me a grand total of 3 minutes to set-up with the stand. The TV, while none as thin as many of the other LEDs, is still pretty thin compared to LCDs (which are still pretty much the norm right now). The picture quality, isn't as great as say, a Samsung or a Sony. Obviously, it isn't 1080p, but the slight difference between 720p and 1080p never bothered me anyways. I'm mostly going to use this TV for gaming, and most games only output in 720p as it is. The colors on this TV aren't vibrant. They are subtle and natural, and I prefer it that way. Once again, this TV won't give you the quality you will find in other, much more expensive TVs from top-tier brands. But for $210? It blows away every other TV in that price range. This TV delivers at least double the price it is worth. I highly recommend this TV and I could not be happier with my purchase.As a sidenote, I cannot speak for the longevity of this TV, as I've only had it for a few days. I'm crossing my fingers that this TV will stay intact for the next few years.

Reviews.Title: Tv that beats LG, Toshiba, and Samsung in this price range
Reviews.Author: abelabliss
Reviews.Content: Honestly this tv is perfect for the price. The quality is sharp, vibrant, and has great contrast. Very easy to maneuver around the settings and channels. I got it for $200 so I was extremely happy and agreed with a lot fo the reviews here. i can't stress it enough that everyone should by this Tv for their bedroom and if they're look for something below $350. I don't think the sound is bad at all, I know it could be better but it's definitely not bad. I use it to watch Netflix and play on my Xbox (Halo 4) and both look so sharp and awesome.  There are noticeable grains in the depth of field but you only notice them when your paying attention to them. But there are scenes in shows that have amazing clarity and sharpness. The size is perfect and allows the 720p and 60hz to be perfect for it's size. Its all so balanced. The black frame has a really nice stainless steel look to it. It is a bit wobbly but i know that is fixable and its only if your pushing it, it stays perfectly still on my tv stand. I've only had it for 5 days but so far i'm in love with it. I bought the $30 3 year warranty just to be stress free. In  a short sentence, get this TV if you're looking for something in this price range with great clarity and overall appearance. Also I love that it has the USB port! I used it today to listen to music and it was awesome. I read someone else say that headphones aren't too good in this Tv but i have to disagree they sound really good. I have a pair of Sony MDR-V6 Monitor Series Headphones with CCAW Voice Coil. And those are mainly for recording studios, but they sound great on this Tv.

Reviews.Title: Wow!!!
Reviews.Author: Jeff B.
Reviews.Content: This tv is the best example of why these reviews are so important.  I never heard of this brand led tv.  The price point was much lower than anything out there.  The reviews where all very good and descriptive  So I figured what the heck; let's give I a try!  Well,  The picture is beautiful.  The sound is just fine for the size room it is in (12 by 12).  The overall value and quality is well worth it.  Of course, time will tell about its longevity.I highly recommend it and say keep those reviews coming

Reviews.Title: Great overall quality for the $$; audio output could be better.
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: There were three reasons why I chose this Sceptre TV over a similar Samsung product: 1.) I purchased a Sceptre 19" widescreen monitor five years ago and was thrilled with its quality, so I already felt confident in this television's quality.  2.) At the purchase price of $179, it was much less expensive than the 32" Samsung I had looked at.  3.) It was not going to be our primary television, but a second set to stop the family from quibbling when programs conflicted.PROS:* Excellent value.* Bright, superb picture quality.* Crystal clear sound with adjustable equalizer.* Three HDMI ports.* VGA port allows for use as computer monitor.* USB port permits the playback of mp3 and JPEG images with slideshow.* Base allows for adjusting viewing angle.* Lightweight, yet base keeps set stable.* Instructions, screwdriver, screen cloth all packaged together.CONS:* Audio output (loudness/volume) isn't as strong as expected.* Remote not backlighted.* Only one wall mount bracket option (400mm x 200mm).I really like having three HDMI ports on this set. I have only two on my nice 42" Samsung that I purchased earlier this year. The screen menus are clear and easy to follow, and set-up was very simple. Silly as it sounds, I even liked finding the instructions, power cord, base hardware and a small ergonomic phillips screwdriver in a heavy-duty vinyl pouch with a zipper seal.When I did my research on this set I saw reviews complaining that the USB port was useless. Really, it's not. It's only useless if you want a USB port on your TV to play back *video*. The instruction booklet clearly states that the USB port will allow you to display JPEG images ONLY (baseline, not progressive) and the set has a built-in slideshow feature. The set can handle mp3 audio file data rates from 32-320kbs. Your USB must be formatted as FAT32 or FAT16, and the largest file size the set can handle is 4GB. The set's USB port also does not handle USB hubs.The negatives about this set are minor, but one thing does stand out: the volume control. It's not the clarity-the set has bright highs once I adjusted the equalizer-it's the audio output that could be a little better. Adjusting the volume doesn't make a whole heck of a lot of difference between the 50 and 100 settings. Cranked up to full (100) volume, the set is certainly loud enough in a medium-sized room. Our set rests inside a large oak armoire cabinet in a 15 x 15 room and it works well there.The back of the set has only four mounting holes for a wall mounting bracket. The Olevia set this is replacing had six, allowing for more mounting options. Not a deal-breaker, but something to be aware of. And, of course, my other minor deal is the fact that the remote doesn't have a backlighted key pad. Most everyone now has cable or satellite, so the supplied remotes are universal and pretty clear to see, so (honestly) this is a petty issue.Would I buy this set again? Yes! No regrets here, and I would've given this 4 1/2 stars if I could have. It's a great secondary television, or even a great primary television in a medium-sized room.

Reviews.Title: Good tv for the price
Reviews.Author: kates1937
Reviews.Content: We ordered this not expecting too much due to the low price, but we have been enjoying it so far. It's not a perfect HD picture, but it is again definitely worth the 200 dollars. It arrived VERY quickly, and looks nice. The remote is easy to use, and it was easy to set up. I would say if you are looking for a tv for a guest bedroom or an alternate space, or if you're ok with not having the perfect picture/sound, but you're looking for something decent that's cheap, this is a good tv to purchase. I would NOT purchase if you are really into HD and expect perfection out of the picture and sound. It's a good deal, but remember that you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my criteria
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: There are lots of  32 inch TVs out there and I could've picked from the variety. I picked this not because of the price, but because of my criteria. This item exceeded my expectation. Perfect for the criteria I used to make the purchase, with my primary criteria being the width to be less than 30 inches, for a 32 inch LCD, LED TV. Sound is great too, and I like all 3 HDMI connections, with color-coded connectors.

Reviews.Title: Screen backlight went dark within 2 weeks
Reviews.Author: Heiko Ramirez "Daku"
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers I was hesitant to purchase a non-top brand. When it arrived I was happy. It's surprisingly light and easy to set up. My wife and I used this for a couple weeks on and off and just 15 minutes ago I turned it on to discover half the screen is no longer backlit. The right half of the screen is practically dark and hard to see. When I went in to try and get it replaced I found it's no longer being sold. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Unknown Name- Worthy Performance
Reviews.Author: B. Pelton "SoCal Bruce"
Reviews.Content: We, like others, were concerned because we have never heard of this brand. We were reassured by other reviews and now very happy we purchased it. The overall quality is great and the brilliance, contrast and color accuracy all very good. It handles high speed motion well. It has 3 HDMI inputs in addition to discrete audio, component video, headphone, VGA, Coax and USB. The remote is good and the set-up flawless.The only negative issue a potential purchaser needs to be aware of is the mounting locations for a wall bracket. They are 400mm X 200mm (15.75" x 7.87") which limits the selection of available brackets for this 20 pound wonder. This kind of spacing is normally used for 42 inch and larger sets. We found that many of the brackets this size almost cost as much as the TV.

Reviews.Title: Tainted screen
Reviews.Author: Jose Garcia "José R. García"
Reviews.Content: Well, you get what you pay for... I paid $209 for this LED TV which would have been a real deal if not because of it's big flaw. Not sure if it happens to everyone or if it's just that I got the black sheep of these TVs. Anyways I'll describe the issue below.It happens that the two lower corners, specially the left one, have a strong yellow glow, that can be seen when the screen is black or when you are whatching a fairly dark scene at night, or when you are watching a movie in widescreen so that there's a black bar at the botton and top of the screen. This yellow glow is really distracting.I have noticed that if you apply pressure on specific points of the frame this glow will disappear, so I'll take it to a workshop to see if they can fix it. I have also noticed that the stain grows bigger the more time the TV is on. I'm not sure about what causes this but it shouldn't happen on a new TV.Still If you are planning to play bright, full screen scenes then there won't be a problem for you, since this glow/stain is not visible at daylight or when plaing something bright, it's just visible when playing dark scenes at night with the lights off.Thanks for reading and I hope it helps you make an informed purchase.

Reviews.Title: CANT BEAT QUALITY  4 PRICE!!
Reviews.Author: TEAO
Reviews.Content: For  $200  this  Television is NOTHING  SHORT OF  AWESOME!!  I have DIRECT TV  watching HD  receivers in 1080  and the  picture  is  great the  kids  love it  and  you WILL NOT beat it  for the  price!!  I have  an LG LED  42 inch and it definitely has  a  BETTER  picture  but  the price  gap between the  two  does NOT  warrant the large  cost  gap!!! IF you want a  simple  REALLY nice  TV  for a PC  kids  room, kitchen  this is it!!!  I was  a bit  uncertain a first  but  VERY  PLEASE!!  I have  two of these  in my kids  ROOM GREAT  BUY!!  WILL  definitely  recommend

Reviews.Title: Picture's great
Reviews.Author: Lou
Reviews.Content: I think the picture was great, and considering the price, I don't see the benefit to purchasing a more expensive model.

Reviews.Title: Not reliable
Reviews.Author: Kenneth P. James
Reviews.Content: 2 months old and it doesn't work at all.  Have to box it up and return to manufacturer for repairs.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for price
Reviews.Author: M Carmi "M Carmichael"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my bedroom and it is perfect for the money.  The sound isn't great but just to watch it for 30-60 minutes in the evening it's not a problem (though I did knock off one star for this).  The picture quality is good and was easy to mount with a universal mount that I bought separately.  I was a little concerned about my Directv remote being able to find a code for the TV since it isn't a very well known brand but I did find a fully functional code (code 10000).  This is important to me because I have bought an off brand before and was stuck using two different remotes!  I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Totally worth the price...so far!
Reviews.Author: KALV
Reviews.Content: Sceptre E325BV-HDH 32-Inch 720p 60Hz LED HDTV (Black)I'm not into having the latest and greatest technology, so when I needed a new TV I prepared myself for a daunting task.  I just wanted a cheaply priced TV that had a decent picture and decent sound (no weird humming or ringing).This TV was exactly what I wanted...definitely worth the price.  **Keep in mind that I only paid $179 for this model.  I would not be as happy if I paid $299.**The only reason I did not give this 5 stars is because the following:-TV frame is very cheap plastic and not quite perfectly put together.  Nothing really noticeable unless you're looking for imperfections.-The backlighting is also uneven.  When the screen is dark you can really notice it.  Surprisingly, it doesn't affect the picture to me.-The remote looks and feels very cheap.  It almost feels like a toy remote.  That doesn't bother me though.Let see how this does long term...I will update my review if anything happens.

Reviews.Title: If it comes on, it's really good.
Reviews.Author: MagnoliaSouth "As soon go kindle fire with sn...
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box, the TV refused to come on. I called the manufacturer, thinking we'd hooked something up wrong, but no. There should be a home screen if the power is on despite if anything is hooked up to it, according to tech support.He said he could send a replacement (he emailed me a form that I am not happy about because I have to fax it to him along with a copy of the invoice, this is an additional expense I shouldn't have to make) and then once I got the replacement I could send this one to him. While I was sitting there on the phone with him, the TV suddenly came on. Odd. We turned it back off and no surprise, it wouldn't come back on. About 10-15 minutes later it finally came on again. lol! It's the strangest thing. The tech guy said it should not take that long to warm up. He said he thought that maybe it would do that if it were about 40°F, but one, it had been sitting in the house a couple of hours and two, we live in Mobile, Alabama. It rarely gets 40°F and even more rarely that temp in November! It was in the 60s when it was delivered.So, we're leaving it on until the new set gets here. Now all that said, let me talk about its function. Keep in mind, this is obviously a defective TV set. When the new one comes, and I've no idea how long that will be, this may change.My non-HD Directv picture isn't all that great. In fact, I'd say it's slightly blurry. On the other hand, the HD picture from my son's games and the bluray and even Netflix are all amazingly clear. I think it's just time to upgrade my Directv receiver.I don't use the TV sound because I have a surround sound system. However, I will say that it works beautifully with even the oldest surround system known to mankind. Ours is a 1996 RCA, with RCA (red and white) plugs... I kid you not. It was top of the line in its day, but it is ancient now. Unlike our other TVs, this new one finally has an RCA out plug for old stereos. I couldn't believe it! That alone makes it worth its purchase, in my opinion.There is still a problem though. You would think that since the TV is putting OUT the sound, that it (TV) would control the volume it is sending out via the jacks, but nope, it doesn't. That means you'll have to use yet another remote, the one for your receiver. If I had one serious complaint, that would be it. Even my ancient rabbit ear TV would at least control the volume out via another source. I'm not sure why this one failed on that.It's very lightweight, has tons of plug options and even swivels. I really do like this TV. I just wish that it powered up better because were it not for that, I'd keep this one.The other thing is that I want you all to know that the tech support was very helpful. I called at 5:30 p.m. CDT and not only managed to get someone, but managed to get someone who speaks clearly and I didn't have to wait but less than 1 minute. I couldn't believe it. That is always a good sign. Also, he emailed me the forms and by the time I hung up and got to my desk, it was in my inbox. I love companies that treat you like a valued customer and this one did just that.All in all, I think it will be a good deal. If only it worked right out of the box and I wish I didn't have to go through the trouble of sending it back.The link to download the PDF manual is in the first comment under my review here.UPDATE: Just got the new set. I first contacted the manufacturer but I didn't like their exchange policy. I would have to fax (I don't have a fax) a copy of their form that they emailed to me and an invoice (which Amazon doesn't send with it) that I would have to print out from my Amazon account. Then I'd have to wait for their ship labels and once I got those, I would have to take the TV down to UPS or wherever. I ended up exchanging it with Amazon and they'll even send someone to pick it up. So much easier!Anyway, the new TV works like a dream. I'm very satisfied. It takes no more than 5 seconds to turn on. That was fresh out of the box. I'm not sure if there is a battery in there, but after being plugged in overnight, it came on instantly the next morning.All in all, I'm very satisfied but I do have to recommend some sort of external speaker system. It has a headphone jack, so if you can find external speakers that have that same jack, you may be able to use those.

Reviews.Title: Confusing Model #'s and Specs-but all GOOD!
Reviews.Author: E. Smith
Reviews.Content: I saw a Sceptre model E325BV-HD on sale at Walmart (online) for $179.99 (NOT-"HDH" model)on Thanksgiving day and as usual came to Amazon to search reviews.  The reviews were for Sceptre E325BV-HDH and I could not find any reviews for the E325BV-HD model.  I went to the Sceptre website and found that they are indeed 2 different 32" Tv's with different specs.  The 325BV-HD indicates a refresh rate of 6.5ms (HDH=8ms)and brightness spec of 420 cd/m2 (HDH-250 cd/m2).  The measurements were also different with the 325BV-HD width of 1.88" and the HDH model 2.1".  The measurements in width/height/depth(W/and W/O stand were also different. I read many reviews for the "HD" model on the Walmart website (very positive)so decided to place my order there.  It was "comforting" to also notice the positive reviews for the "HDH" model here on the Amazon site.Anyway, I received the TV yesterday and guess what!?  The model I received was the E325BV-"HDH" model as reviewed here!  I didn't bother to inquire about the mix-up as the TV has a very good picture and after playing with the audio settings it also has pretty good sound for placement in a bedroom.  In fact, I cancelled an order for a soundbar as I feel that the TV speakers are above average for a small LED TV. I, also decided to keep this model since at the Sceptre website the MSRP is $599.00 compared to $499.00 for the "HD" model.  I know, MSRP is ridiculous!  But, go figure, the specs are actually higher on the "HD" model with the lower MSRP. I also know that these specs don't always indicate one model is superior over the other.NOTE:  FEDEX delivered the package in it's original box with a huge split/tear all the way down the front of the box.  I feared the worst, since it was the side with the screen facing the tear- I slid my hand inside and pulled it apart (expecting a cracked screen) and saw no damage.  FEDEX truck was long gone!  Anyway-easy set-up and darn good picture quality for only $179.99.  Despite the confusion/mix-up in model numbers, I'm completely satisfied (the reviews here and at Walmart assured me both models were highly rated).  Also, wife just noticed an approx. 1/2 inch dent/scratch on the top of the surrounding bezel/border-very slight and hardly noticeable.  Still keeping it!

Reviews.Title: It's okay for the price
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: The Sceptre 32 inch led tv is okay for what it was priced for. It came in all nicely packaged I love how you can move the screen left or right without having to lift up the tv to connect the video and audio ports of my playstation to the left side. One problem though is when i got it, i noticed it had one dead pixel haha. It was annoying at first but it's wayyy better than my old big butt tv. The audio is kind of crappy but it does the job just don't expect fantastic speakers from this Tv. And on the left and right bottom corners there seems to be light coming out whenever there is a full black screen you could easily notice it. It's a great tv and it does the job for me because my old tv broke haha2 months later edit:Ended up getting a price match back in black friday of 2012. Bought it originally at $199.99 but got it for $179.99 for price match. The tv still looks great, Hdmi cables hooked up from my ps3 to the Sceptre Led Tv look fantastic. Only one dead pixel from when i first got it but oh well. The sound is okay but the picture quality makes up for it. So still works and looks great :]

Reviews.Title: PLEASE don't do it!
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: Horrible TV - worked for exactly 1 year and then the screen turned purple (panel connection failure).Company did NOTHING about it - basically told me "sorry about your luck but you are a couple of weeks past the 1 yr warranty".Do yourself a favor and buy a REPUTABLE brand TV even if it costs you a little more!

Reviews.Title: Sound already broke
Reviews.Author: gary cunningham
Reviews.Content: Had it less than a year. Turned it on today and had no sound. Messed with all the settings etc. Nothing :(  Very upsetting.

Reviews.Title: Great For The Price
Reviews.Author: J. Keith Contarino
Reviews.Content: Wanted a basic HDTV for the bedroom and this model fit the bill. Had never heard of Spectre but at the price I figured why not give it a try? Am very glad I did. Picture looks as good as some of the Samsungs I've seen and it is light enough and stable enough to but on a bookcase

Reviews.Title: Great Price for Quality Product.
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I really like this product for the price and quality I received.  It looks great in my bedroom hanging on the wall, and i have had zero problems with anything with this tv.  GREAT BUY

Reviews.Title: Crappy speakers, Great everythign else
Reviews.Author: BanditKeith
Reviews.Content: **7 Month EditEverything is still wonderful as described!  I'm still really happy with this TV, especially now that I have it hooked up to a better audio system.**Quick setup (they even include a cute little screwdriver for the stand!) and ease of use combined with great picture quality makes this a great buy for a mid-sized TV.  I use it in a dorm room, and it's really the perfect size.  The speakers are garbage, but that's to be expected of any flat-screen tv, let alone such an inexpensive one like this.  Just plug in even the cheapest of cans to improve the audio quality.  Of course, a sexy sound system is always the best idea, but alas, if you're buying this at my price range, the sound system must wait awhile.  I got it on black friday for $180, so try finding this for that much.PRO:Ease of setupPicture quality3 HDMI slotsLots of audio jacksPrice!Low energy use!Excellent choice for a cheap 2nd computer monitorCON:Crap speakers as expectedUSB port does not support video files (only JPEG and audio)If a great picture for a great price is what you need, then here's your tv.

Reviews.Title: EEXCELLENT SELLER BUT...!
Reviews.Author: Juan Manuel Chirinos
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT SELLER, WAS A GOOD EXPERIENCE THE TV WAS THE SAME THAT I WANTED BUT THE TV HAVE A LITTLE BLUE LINE IN THE SCREEN AND I DIDN'T KNOW WHY...

Reviews.Title: Sceptre 32 inch led tv
Reviews.Author: Stef
Reviews.Content: I am in afghanistan right now and i wanted a nice tv to watch my movies and tv show. But ive receive the tv broken, the lower left corner have a big yellow spot.

Reviews.Title: Spectre, Surprisingly GREAT BRAND!!!
Reviews.Author: Robert Fox
Reviews.Content: Here is a few things I know about this awesome little TV:Spectre was in the market of making computer monitors, which explains a lot of the reason this TV had so many options and customization. Now the reason you don't know their brand is because they worked for larger companies (having them slap the labels on their manufacturing) until their branched out on their own.I was a little hesitant to buy this at the price of 150$ because the last debacle I ran into with a 37 inch Proscan PLED3792A was terrible for 250$ I had to take it back. Later, I found out I got this one for a steal!Pros:-Easy interface with plenty of options. (So many, if you aren't a techno-geek like me you wouldn't know what to do with.)-Great Value for the price-Quality (so far had it 3 months, no problems at all.)-WORKS GREAT WITH COMPUTERS (This is an awesome + for me)-Displays in 1080p downstream even though it says 720p (means it doesn't offically display in 1080p, but will support it) don't even notice the difference from my friends 1080p at this size. (As long as you have about 6~10 feet distance away from the screen)Cons:-Contrast ratio could be better (just comparing it to my Asus VE228H, so take it as you will)-VESA 200x400 mount! (The 37 inch proscan worked with my mount, but this smaller TV decided to go with the larger proprietary VESA screw setup. I had to pay 20$ for an adapter, but with the money I saved, worth it!)MAKE SURE YOU GET THE RIGHT MOUNT! Otherwise you will end up paying some extra money for an adapter for this guy. Otherwise, I love this thing. It is awesome and performs better than my friends smart TV Sometimes, you just find the diamond in the rough in Generic TVs, and this is it.WOULD RECOMMEND AS GO TO 32 INCH TV FOR GREAT PRICE! One of the best LED TVs I had yet!

Reviews.Title: Great Value, a couple of things to consider
Reviews.Author: Bill Macy
Reviews.Content: First, this is a great tv for the price. I got it on Amazon for $199 delivered. It is light, thin, and very sleek looking with a nice polished bezel. It has all the connections you would need, and the sound out of the internal speakers is decent, but may consider buying some inexpensive PC speakers, as others have mentioned. Typical packaging you might get with a monitor (well packaged), and came in perfect condition.Here are my pros, and a couple of cons:Pros:1) Thin, light, nice looking2) Good picture quality (720p) for my particular need3) Good assortment of input connections (3x HDMI + all the other standard connections you may need)4) Great value for the price5) Comes with a couple of extras that are nice to have, that don't even come with more expensive tvs that I have bought (microfiber cloth for dusting screen, mini screwdriver for installing/removing base, batteries for remote....etc)6) Sleep button on the remote instead of embedded within a menu somewhere (my Phillips TV doesnt have a sleep button on the remote, and it is annoying, this is the only reason why I mention it.Cons:1) I didn't like the placement of the coax input. The way they placed the plug makes it a little difficult to connect the cable. If you have stubby fingers like me, you may need a wrench to tighten the connection2) To switch source inputs, you have to click source, then use arrows (tow different buttons). If you frequently change inputs like I do, it would have been better if you could just click source to cycle through the various inputs.I would recommend this TV without hesitation. The pros far, far outweigh any cons I have found. Very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Quality
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a TV that falls under the Sony umbrella.  It was easy set up.  I do recommend you reading the instructions - my husband skimmed over it and missed the universal Sony code to program the remote.  I think the picture quality is as good as our Samsung smart TV.  The only differences are all the 'bells & whistles' but we didn't buy it for playing video games or other stuff.  We have our Sony blu-ray hooked to this TV and it's been smooth sailing.  We bought this TV to replace an 14yr old one - so the LED was the main attraction.  I would definitely buy this brand again.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV... GREAT PRICE
Reviews.Author: Mely
Reviews.Content: I got this tv for my mom.... has a great picture and the audio is excellent.  I am  waiting for it to be in stock available so i can buy one for me :)

Reviews.Title: BLOWN AWAY
Reviews.Author: ronathome "ronathome"
Reviews.Content: I was blown away by the performance and value of this tv.  I was kinda torn because it was only a 720p machine.  But it is absolutely stunning in my bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV
Reviews.Author: GABRIEL D LAQUIS
Reviews.Content: Exactly as advertised. Crisp 720p HD video, even 1080p clips looks really good.Great sound and adjustable options as well.Looks very sleek and perfect for a bedroom or small to medium size living room....I like !

Reviews.Title: Nice basic TV
Reviews.Author: Dan Lauer
Reviews.Content: very good picture quality, pretty basic design but makes a great bedroom tv.  Excellent value and it was just what I expected.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Jeff Green
Reviews.Content: I have not found any cons on this TV yet.  It is so new, my DirecTV remote won't program to it, but that's the only thing!  It's a basic tv and doesn't have all the bells and whistles that some of the higher end TV's have like wifi and services like netflix, but you aren't paying for all those bells and whistles!Worth the price!

Reviews.Title: Sceptre LED 32" set is a WINNER
Reviews.Author: Roland A. Krause
Reviews.Content: Great set-easy set up-great picture. Outstanding price. Can't thiunk of any better deal. Will buy another as soon as Christmas is over. Buy it-you will love it!!! i do.

Reviews.Title: Surpringly very good for the money
Reviews.Author: LA6507
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with the picture quality on this 720p LED TV.  The color and sharpness of this TV looks better than my Viera Panasonic plasma (at 720p) and my Toshiba 1080p LCD TV for OTA broadcasts in HD. This is a must have for 32" HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: lmoore
Reviews.Content: After one month of use, the TV is an Excellent Value/Quality for the money!  I like the thin design, just right for wall hanging.  ...... only negative feature is it lacks a 'sleep timer' set by the clock 'off time'.

Reviews.Title: great value!
Reviews.Author: Harris Mills
Reviews.Content: Picture is great and it is the perfect size for the bedroom. The stand is a bit flimsy, but  the tv is very light. At 199.00, a great value!

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT TV
Reviews.Author: LORI
Reviews.Content: This was a Black Friday special, and I couldn't be more pleased.  Beautiful picture, excellent sound.  Just as expected.  I'd buy another Sceptre in the future.  I do agree with other ratings, though, that it would've been nice for the remote to be backlit.  That is the only thing bringing this down to 4 stars from 5.

Reviews.Title: Spectre E325BV-HDH 32-Inch 720p 60Hz LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: Penn and Tell'em
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Spectre E325BV in November of 2012 from Amazon and shipping was extemely fast.  My review is based on my particular setup and not other reviews.Setup: I have a standard def. Verizon FIOS cable box and I am using COAX connectivity only for this unit.  This TV will be used only for the kids and I was not looking for the highest video quality.  For the price, 720p with 60Hz is going to be "grainy" during high motion video, but I expected that and was not dissapointed. Only time will tell, but I knew going into this purchase that I was not going to have HD quality using standard definition exquipment on a 60hz refresh rate.The Good:The look of the TV is more of a matte black and looks great.Setup was a very easy.There are multiple connectivity options for this TV.  I am currently using the coax. at this point, but I am always in the need of a VGA and audio input so I can connect a computer to the TV.The TV is light in weight and can be moved around easily.The Bad:So far I am happy with the purchase and have only one complaint.  The sound is very low and I need to turn the volume up to be able to hear clearly.  I can always connect external speakers, but it is only a small issue.The "Meh":The remote is "blah" in the looks department, but it works fine.  I was able to find the remote code for this TV on the Verizon FIOS website and am now using the cable box remote to control the TV.I would purchase this unit again, and might even buy a second one if I don't have any issues over the next few weeks.I give this product four stars only because there is always room for improvement.Sceptre E325BV-HDH 32-Inch 720p 60Hz LED HDTV (Black)

Reviews.Title: THIS IS A "TEN"
Reviews.Author: sgthollomon
Reviews.Content: A very good TV at an affordable price. Amazon shipped this item to me with uncanny speed. The quality of this TV matches that of my larger Sony and Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great tv for the bedroom
Reviews.Author: Hettty B "Hetty B"
Reviews.Content: Needed a simple easy to operate tv because I'm a digital settler.  Wanted it for the bedroom just for late night news and mindless shows....It was easy to assemble, instructions were clear and easy.  Did have difficulty getting a full screen until tech support told me to check my source settings. Voila! Great tv for the money!  I just got it a couple of days ago.  We'll see how it is in 90 days......

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Craig Bloom
Reviews.Content: The product came well packed and arrived in perfect condition. This was my first flat panel TV and I am amazed at he quality of hte picture and sound. I used to run the audio thru a stereo, but this TV has AVL and it WORKS! Now the volume remains the same for the shows and the commercials.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and a great price!
Reviews.Author: Deer Hunter
Reviews.Content: Thanksgiving night deal $179! I was so disappointed when Wal-Mart sold out of the $148 Emmerson 32in LCD TV before they even went on sale that I went home without waiting around for the raincheck and ordered this TV on amazon.com. I am so glad that I didn't wait around in Wal-mart for hours and hours on Thanksgiving night. I got a much better TV for about $30 more and shipping was free.My new TV arrived right at my front door (only 4 days after I ordered it). Set up was very easy and everything was included in the box for assembly. The picture is perfect (as good or better than the 42" inch HiSense LED 1080pi  TV in my living room.) I would definitely recommend this TV to a friend. I wish I would have purchased a Sceptre brand TV for the other TVs in my house. Amazon.com is the only way to shop for Black Friday!

Reviews.Title: Sweet TV
Reviews.Author: RobinHood
Reviews.Content: I got the TV on a great black friday deal, and it is awesome. Definitely like the display, plays my xbox great. Also the three ports is very nice. If you are using it with direct tv you do need to use the remote configuration for Sony 10000 for it to work right. It was only packaged in its original box when shipped which was odd, but the tv itself is great.

Reviews.Title: Really Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Lucky Guy
Reviews.Content: Got this for $200 shipped with Prime.The picture is better than anything else i've seen at this price range.The sound is not that great but it's a small LED TV, can't expect too much.I just use this to play Netflix, Hulu, etc as well as Black Ops II.  In my bedroom it's perfect.I also love that it swivels on the base.  Not sure how many TVs do that but it was a nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: Completely Functional
Reviews.Author: Robert Murphy
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son and his roommates at college.  It works exactly as it should.  There are probably better TVs but not at this price point.

Reviews.Title: Name and price made me skeptical BUT!
Reviews.Author: Brian M.
Reviews.Content: Pros-Price-Very good picture-Easy to set up-Wrapped nice and neat.Cons-The stand seems to sag just a little bitI have never heard of Sceptre but I will diffidently be buying from them again!

Reviews.Title: Overall great
Reviews.Author: Lazybacon04
Reviews.Content: If you are reading this, chances are you've read and will continue to read many more reviews for this product.Look, if you are looking for a good TV at a cheap price, you can't go wrong with this one. It's slim. The picture is great. Sound is decent. The only "complaint" I have is that the remote has to be pointed directly at the tv to work, but even then it's not a big deal for the price and paying for and the quality you are getting.Some reviews have commented on the response time being a bit too slow and causing lag. I play my xbox on this all the time and I haven't had a problem with the response time.If you are looking for a TV that supports wifi, has "amazing" sound and picture quality (whatever that means), does your laundry and throws out the trash, this tv is NOT for you. However, if you are looking for a nice, simple tv for watching shows and playing games, this tv IS for you.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations.
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV on the strength of previous reviews, and I couldn't be more happy with my purchase. I own two LCD televisions; this is my first LED tv. The TV has a fantastic picture, and, as previous reviewers have mentioned- you shouldn't sweat the lack of 1080p resolution. This TV's 720p maximum resolution is every bit as pleasing as some 1080p LCD screens I have seen. The black casing is slim and attractive, and the sound isn't too shabby either. If you're looking for a solid LED television at a great price, this is the unit for you.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Al Hatch
Reviews.Content: Arrived early, the directions really are not good, though someone said they were. It does come with a screw driver and screen wipe. Also does have all the hook-ups you need for xbox 360 with just cables or HDMI. Though I couldn't get the satellite to work when I tried to hook it up on the coax, but I was probably using the wrong thing. I just use mine for games. It does have a few dead pixels, but it's not really a big deal, and you can't tell unless the screen is all black.

Reviews.Title: Cheap product (you get what you pay for) and poor customer service
Reviews.Author: hatestoshop
Reviews.Content: I usually make a point not to buy cheap "Made in China" stuff, but as I'm not a big t.v. watcher I was trying to cut financial corners on this purchase.  The fact Wal-Mart sells this brand/model should have been a red flag, however, it had so many favorable reviews I took a chance and for the most part the t.v. itself had functioned just fine.  The unit doesn't receive much use; pretty much I watch the news and an occasional sitcom or PBS show and that's about it. No sports, no Honey Boo Boo, no movies.Less than a year after purchase, I watched the late news, went to bed, and when I turned on the t.v. in the a.m. there was audio but no discernible picture.  Colored stripes were going across the screen, so I checked all connections, etc. thinking the dog may have knocked a cable out.  No issues there.  I contacted Sceptre's 1-800 customer service line 3 times over this past week and left a voice mail requesting a call back each time (I don't believe they really have any live folks handling the phone lines in hopes everyone will just e-mail), and just today received a call back from an individual who was quite rude.  He stated they cannot figure out what is wrong with the t.v. until I take a picture of the screen and e-mail it to them.  Can you say STALL TACTIC?Undesirable company, but perhaps I'm one of the few who got a lemon and had to deal with their customer service.  Next time I'll research customer service a little better before making this type of purchase in case something goes awry as it did in this case.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great shipping ordered pm 10/23 received c. noon 10/24/12 free 2nd day yet!Some problems with set-up... needed HDMI cable which had not come yet then Cable box wouldn't work.  Cable TV Tech came next day and it works great!!!  Great price and seems to me a former Analog TV viewer a fantastic picure.  Best news yet, My wife likes it!  How could it get better?Had not noticed that it had two 10W speakers in review.  Have not figured them out yet but will!  again upgrade from 20" analog this is fantastic for our appartment!

Reviews.Title: This has to be the best sub-$200 TV out there (for now)!
Reviews.Author: Creedeco "Tom"
Reviews.Content: Received a day after ordering, I had figured given the price it was worth a shot.  I'd have no reservations recommending this set to anyone in the market for a basic, 32", LED, flatscreen.PROS:  Great picture (especially with 1080P input from a DVD player), passable sound, plentiful inputs and outputs, lots of adjustments you can make (if you feel the need), inexpensive, thin, very lightweight (I've got a 1st. generation, 32", LCD flatscreen at home that tips the scales over 50 lbs; this set might go 15), functional and simple remote, and a really nice-looking gal on the cover of the box!CONS:  Coaxial digital sound out (instead of optical, not a big deal for me since I don't plan to use the feature); still not a lot of room-filling sound given the supposed 10 Watts being sent to each speaker (but enough to be heard across the room in a quiet environment); my wife says its mounting location blocks her view of the mountains a little bit; your techno-geek-snob cousin will stop by and tell you all about the name brand set he paid three-times the money for(a year ago)with all the built-in apps - and he'll ask how many apps your Sceptre has (Answer: none); 400x200 VESA mounting holes will leave you searching for a flexible wall mount (another 32" LED set I own has 100x100 mounting holes [much more accomodating]).Summary: The "CONS" above don't amount to a hill of beans for me since I have the set sitting on its stand, I told my wife to clam-up and move over a foot or so, and my geek cousin lives a thousand miles away. If you need apps, buy an inexpensive nettop or netbook and hook it up to the set via a VGA and sound cable, or HDMI cable. Just buy the thing and enjoy all the money you saved!

Reviews.Title: Recommend this TV
Reviews.Author: Kiril Angov "Kiril Angov"
Reviews.Content: Share all good points from the rest of the 10+ reviews. I can definitely see some light bleeding on the right side of the TV and it can be a little bothering on black scenes BUT totally not an issue 99% of the time. The sound is just enough. Maybe better TVs have better sound, I would not know.Unless there is some factory defect, this TV would be great for everybody who likes this form factor. Definitely dig the thin frame and the base is definitely strong enough for the TV.

Reviews.Title: Surprised!
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: i read few one star review before i purchase this tv, i thought just take a chance, if the tv is really that bad i can always return it. it turned out great!32inch tv for $200, the quality is amazing for the price,looks sharp!

Reviews.Title: tv
Reviews.Author: sharon marshall
Reviews.Content: this was a really good buy. I have had it awhile now but if I had to get another I definitely get another one

Reviews.Title: What a Surprise!
Reviews.Author: Buffi
Reviews.Content: This was gifted to me by my children for an early Mother's Day surprise! The picture is beautiful and the sound is fantastic! I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Tv 32"
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: Really happy with this tv,really cheap and it's doing the job,I like the slim design the picture is really clear.

Reviews.Title: Will buy this brand again
Reviews.Author: Deanna L VanAlmkerk
Reviews.Content: I have now had this TV for a year and a half and have loved it, its my main TV.  I waited to give a review cause I have never bought a TV brand that I didn't know and I hadn't heard of this brand till I bought this one.  Thanks for a great TV!

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: Kristen B.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV a little over a year ago and still use it as a secondary TV in my apartment. I haven't had any issues with it thus far, but the volume could be a little better. The picture is pretty good, and was even better after my cable company decided to use a new converter for their basic cable TVs. The true HD quality then came out that wasn't there when plugged directly to the cable line in the wall. (If you have a cable box then disregard the last few comments). Good size TV for a small living room/bedroom.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Jio del Toro "jojobean"
Reviews.Content: I've had it for a year, and it's still working *knock on wood.* It's a good picture quality, and it has three hdmi plugs, which is REALLY helpful. The quality for PS3 games and HD TV isn't destorted, and doesn't look grainy. And for this price, umm...it's pretty damn good haha.

Reviews.Title: works well
Reviews.Author: Possum Trot "Possum"
Reviews.Content: TV was inexpensive, off brand, but we've had ours over a year with no problem.  Easy to assemble, has the new ports for WiiU.  Light weight.

Reviews.Title: So so...
Reviews.Author: Stevie Ray
Reviews.Content: Decent tv for the price. I bought it to play Xbox on. The sound quality is sub par. The picture itself is okay. I did notice some ghosting when dark colors are on the screen and a found two pixels were burnt out or what you would see as white dots. Not a big deal for cheap gaming tv You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Worth Way More
Reviews.Author: Hugh
Reviews.Content: Its great overall. The only bad things are the speakers, but a cheap 20$ Cyber Acoustics speaker system will make it great, or any other system. And also, on really dark screens, there's a faint bright white spot on the top of the screen, but only on dark dark screens, otherwise its hardly noticeable. Super thin and plenty of slots, with HDMI slots. There is also an red and white rca slot for your speakers, and a headphone jack (for some speakers). You should for sure ignore all bad reviews, ITS 200$ and i would buy it for 400. Plus, each product always has its lemons, so thats all the 1 stars are for, but, trust me, you'll get a good one ;)

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for a great price
Reviews.Author: Grace
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Amazon on black Friday even cheaper than it is being sold right now and all I have to say is that this TV is a great deal. It's 32 inch and though some may think that's small, it's doesn't feel small but rather larger. I love the swivel feature for easy turning and the color looks great.I was skeptical at first to buy a TV brand that I had never heard of, but for such a great price (now 200, still great for such a big HDTV, LED at that!) I went for it. I have no complaints. The screen even seems not to attract much dust. While other parts of the TV are dusty when I dust there never seems to be much on the actual screen itself.If you are on the fence, GET IT! It's a great deal for a great LED HGTV

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture, questionable sound
Reviews.Author: Heather Migdon "Heather Migdon"
Reviews.Content: Why spend 2 to 3 times as much money on a name brand television when this television works just as well. The picture is beautifully clear. If I could make one recommendation for an improvement, I do think that the sound leaves something to be desired. If I am running a box fan for instance the tv sound can be a little difficult to hear.

Reviews.Title: Best picture quality. Most underrated TV ever.
Reviews.Author: Seth B.
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that I have never heard of this brand before. This is easily the most-underrated TV sold on Amazon. The picture is superb, and so good that I can't tell the difference between this screen at 720p compared to my other television at 1080p...the HD quality is an easy match. After seeing the quality of picture on the first time I hooked it up, I sat anxiously waiting 2 A.M. so I could watch Cinemax in HD. The picture was so crisp that I saw parts of the female body that I never knew existed. My wife woke up at one point and thought that the 3 women on the TV were really there in the room. Needless to say, I slept on the couch that night, but I swapped this TV with the 47" Samsung in my living room. If the state of Nebraska allowed me to marry this TV, I would have signed the divorce papers the day this TV arrived - which I might add, it arrived quickly thanks to a great seller.

Reviews.Title: needs help
Reviews.Author: Peggy G.
Reviews.Content: i'm rating this 2 years after i purchased it. great picture quality but poor sound. added speakers and have a great tv

Reviews.Title: Good quality for the price.
Reviews.Author: Kelly M
Reviews.Content: After having this product for almost a year, I am ready to give it a partial review.  If you are looking for a great picture, you will not be disappointed!  I recently was watching tv at someone else's and was surprised at how much better quality the picture is on the Sceptre compared to their tv.  They do have cable tv and I don't, so maybe there was a problem with the cable?  The sound on the Sceptre is pretty good as well.  I originally bought this with the intention of using the screen for my computer monitor, but I never did hook it up so unfortunately I can't give a review on that.  But if all you want is a good tv at a reasonable price, I think you will be happy with the Sceptre.  I just read another review where the buyer had problems with their tv after a year, hoping I don't have the same problem and that my review will stand the test of time.

Reviews.Title: Sceptre tv - will not turn on
Reviews.Author: Tiger Tail "wapiti"
Reviews.Content: Bought two of these Sceptre tvs.  Picture was fine, sound ok but not great.  Seemed a good deal for the price.  Then one of them stopped turning on within 6 months of use.  After contacting Customer Service several times and waiting a month or so for Sceptre to send a box, the tv was sent back to Sceptre for repair, and over a month later it was returned to us.  Plugged the tv in but it would not turn on.  Waste of time!  Did they even do anything to it? So I bought another tv.  Now the second Sceptre tv has started to turn off by itself when you first turn it on, so you have to t urn it on again.  I assume it is a matter of time before it will not turn on at all.  Looking to replace it now.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Landal Kaul
Reviews.Content: Very much love this I us it as a computer screen and as a TV when needed, very good in office.

Reviews.Title: sounds great
Reviews.Author: reviewer5468329
Reviews.Content: It's 1080 does it look good? Duh! But the sound? Out of the box it sounds like !@##%^ but if you're willing to work with it, tinker with the settings, try and try again, it really sounds great. Good bass even. I'm not kidding. If I have any complaint, the screen is actually toooo bright in my office. It's almost as if there's more brightness than warmth if that makes sense. I have a vizio 32, it's warmer by far and just that bit better in every way. For $30-50 next time I'm going back to the V trough.

Reviews.Title: flat screen
Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv to get away from the old big back one I had . I find picture on this very nice . I got it on sale so price was right . For all the brands out there this one is just as good as any . I like the tv .

Reviews.Title: Keeps cutting off
Reviews.Author: Kaylisa Sweeting
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is great, sound quality awesome. How ever it keeps cutting off right in the middle of watching T.V

Reviews.Title: Good Price
Reviews.Author: ALTA WILLIAMS
Reviews.Content: I wish I had purchased one with more pix's, I really didn't know what I needed when ordered. It.It still is working and is viewable.

Reviews.Title: my 32 "
Reviews.Author: SHIRLEY M TUCKER
Reviews.Content: it nice it has a clear picture and a nice slim looks so far its working fine I would recommend this products to otherit save more space from the other bulky one.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working
Reviews.Author: Patty Cohn "pattyc"
Reviews.Content: This tv just stopped working after 8 months of use.  No electrical storms were present, just would not turn on properly one morning.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: sridhar kolluri
Reviews.Content: Excellent product.  This meets all my expectations and we loved it.  I would recommend this product.  I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: great value!
Reviews.Author: Invaluable
Reviews.Content: This TV has a nice picture and plenty of A/V connections for the price I paid.  Purchased for mounting on the wall across the room from our treadmill and it is very easy to see.  This does not have very loud speakers (I have to put the volume at 95 out of 100 to hear it when I'm on my treadmill) but that's the only possible improvement for such a cheap price.

Reviews.Title: great tv!
Reviews.Author: Heidi
Reviews.Content: bought this for my boyfriend for Christmas. I was no doubt a little skeptical buying a tv online. but it has been a great tv for him! it is a little unsteady so i wouldn't recommend to have little children too close to it but it would be fine with older children.Great tv! would buy one for myself! :)

Reviews.Title: good for price
Reviews.Author: Tasha Daley
Reviews.Content: Good for the price. The picture quality is fine however the coaxial cable connection is very weak it broke with one tug. All i in all, a good item.

Reviews.Title: sent to my son he liked it
Reviews.Author: Hank
Reviews.Content: son enjoys it very much but he also has not had a hd ever. I'll check with him later to see if he still enjoys it after a cable hook up

Reviews.Title: Arrived in non- working order
Reviews.Author: mickie
Reviews.Content: It's hard to review this item as it was DOA when it came. So there's not much I can say. I did get promptly refunded, so that was no problem, just the small hassle of repacking and shipping back.

Reviews.Title: Super clear
Reviews.Author: Shon
Reviews.Content: Got this TV and I am really impressed by the quality. Only negative thing I have to say about it is where the inputs are. They are kind of in a spot that seems to put a lot of stress on the actual connectors going into the TV. I haven't had any problems with anything like that, but I am a little concerned. I would definitely buy this TV again if I needed to. Looks really good.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: M. Williams
Reviews.Content: For the price, this TV is an excellent bargain. Initially the television was delivered broken, but I don't think it was because of anything on the seller's part. Delivery services now-a-days are just unreliable in general. Once I informed the seller of the situation he immediately shipped another television, without any problems. Hopefully, the TV will continue to work like it should for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Sceptre
Reviews.Author: vArMiT
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 32 in TV after I realized a 55 in TV was not meant for a bedroom. The picture is gorgeous from any angle, even for it being a 720p.The sound is the only draw back to this television (reason it got 4 stars), but a weak sound should be expected when buying any LED TV. Thinking about investing in a sound bar for it.All in all, a great TV, especially for the price. Will consider this brand when I need to buy another TV.

Reviews.Title: Best Buy
Reviews.Author: JOAN V JACOBSEN
Reviews.Content: Good buy. Picture excellent. Sound is a little tinny for my likes.Shopped price and LED tv's and this beat all.

Reviews.Title: Sceptre has been great and works will with the Droid Razr for watching netflix
Reviews.Author: rudy beljaars
Reviews.Content: the sound quality is so-so but if you have a stereo surround sound system it doesn't matter.  I have been using frequently and have had no problems.  I would never know the difference in the between 720 or 1080.  definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: picture is so-so
Reviews.Author: bbfromtx
Reviews.Content: I expected a better quality picture since it is an LED HDTV. It was a great price and is a good TV for my daughter's room though.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Julia Garcia
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv for the money. Sound is good (although it could be a bit louder) and the image is great! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Decent, but Ghosting
Reviews.Author: Shadow
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for a computer Screen, For its price at the time, it was a good deal. Clear picture, and decent sound.Only problem, after some time, the screen started ghosting images. They go away after a while, but the ghosting starts after only 5-10 min of a still frame.Pros: Nice Picture quality and soundCons: If used as a computer monitor, may cause temp. ghosting after some time.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Griff "Griff"
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the money, I use as a second TV so I don't have to keep taking out kids game boxes, very good picture and sound not brilliant but certainly very good value.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: Smarties
Reviews.Content: lovely tv at a great price. easy to follow set up and use. good picture. ours did have a line that came through the screen, prob a manufacture defect and amazon is replacing it as we speak. I would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my son at Christmas.  For less than $200 you can't miss.  Picture is great in HD and the remote is simple to use.  As with all flat panels, the sound could be better, but what do you expect from a small speaker.  Absolutely worth the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great bedroom tv for the price!
Reviews.Author: Rachel Knight
Reviews.Content: We bought this to replace a tiny bedroom tv.  It was a great price, works great, and looks great.  We were a bit skeptical about the brand, but would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Great Televsion
Reviews.Author: hotty toddy rebel
Reviews.Content: This tv is great, not only did it show a great picture, because of its HD quality, we recieved some extra channels that we wouldn't have gotten. Great tv

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Margaret I. Shilling
Reviews.Content: I love my tv I dont think I could be happier I was worried about ordering a tv online but the company did not fail me.

Reviews.Title: Killer Deal
Reviews.Author: thedream
Reviews.Content: Great picture for an entry level TV.  This thing has a small footprint and thin body.  Picture quality is great.  I have it setup in my bedroom. The remote is OK, however there is a "Sleep" button, which is key for the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Very good value!
Reviews.Author: Tower13
Reviews.Content: The tv is very good. The picture is bright and the tv is easy to set up. The only negative I have is that when you turn on the tv you always get a Sceptre screen before you get the picture. There may be a way to avoid this, but I have not researched it yet.

Reviews.Title: Great picture!!!
Reviews.Author: Walt
Reviews.Content: Sould lacks a little but I don't use the tv speakers. Picture rocks. Just add sound system and you can't go wrong. Great price!!!

Reviews.Title: Very Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Wm
Reviews.Content: This TV is to replace an aging bedroom set.  I was very pleased with the product and the price. Did not expect that combination.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Ted GK
Reviews.Content: Bought for $210 including shipping. Great value. It requires minimal installation and all the necessary tools/pieces are included along with instructions. In my opinion the thin frame makes the actual screen look bigger. I only use it for my PS3, so I can't judge the 720p.

Reviews.Title: Sceptre E325Bv-HDH 32 inch TV
Reviews.Author: jessica Santiago
Reviews.Content: we bought this as a christmas gift for our daughter.  She just loves it  very clear  good quality - will buy another in the near future

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Machell G.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this as a christmas gift. My mother was watching a 22 inch television. Got a great deal on this during christmas. My mother is loving how she doesnt have to squint anymore to see the screen. I would definitely purchase from this seller again.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Tom Prada
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for my bedroom, it works as good, if not better then the expensive LG I have in the livingroom.

Reviews.Title: Nice Picture
Reviews.Author: LiveLoveMyKids
Reviews.Content: Ordered this for my son's room.  He normally plays XBOX with it.  That is connected with a HD cable and the picture is top notch.  However, since he doesn't have a HD cable box and just a regular adapter for cable, the picture is terrible.  Had to return for that reason, but if he had HD for cable, would have been perfect.  He loved that the screen swiveled.  Wish we could have kept it!

Reviews.Title: Exceeds My Expectations
Reviews.Author: J.Mil
Reviews.Content: For a small price of $199 +tax, this TV has exceeded my expections.  The picture is clear, and after changing the default sound settings I have not had any issues with sound.  I really love the matte appearance of the screen - it is easy on my eyes.Before buying this TV I had never heard of Sceptre, but after this experience I am pretty sure my next TV will also be a Sceptre.

Reviews.Title: Great price!
Reviews.Author: Byron
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the purchase and I did not have to make a line at the store on Black Friday!!

Reviews.Title: Really happy with our purchase!
Reviews.Author: Nicolitz
Reviews.Content: Really happy with this purchase.  We were weary, but it has a beautiful picture, looks like a quality television and has decent sound. We've had it about seven months and have had no problems at all.  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Very impressive for it's size and cost
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: Picked it up for sub 200 dollar cost as a bedroom tv.  But have been impressed with the picture size and clarity for a 720p 60hz LED tv.  Driving it with a Direct TV mini Genie at 1080i format with no problem, was surprised the screen view vs. 720p format from Direct TV.

Reviews.Title: Best money I've spent in years
Reviews.Author: Shel20284
Reviews.Content: I think this TV is so much better than most TOP TV makers. For $170 Black Friday Sale (Practically Free) 3 months ago, its worth every penny and even more.

Reviews.Title: excellent quality
Reviews.Author: Nishant Gupta
Reviews.Content: I have been using this for past 2 weeks, using laptop ( through hdmi cables), the picture and sound quality is excellent.No problems so far. very easy setup and easy remote functions.Will recommend this product to fit into the budget.

Reviews.Title: Best 32" TV value you can buy
Reviews.Author: ELLIOT
Reviews.Content: This is a great product. It is easy to set up and is user friendly. Don't let the "name" run you off. It will go head to head with any major brand on the market today....

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Pacific Trail Books
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this LED TV.Great picture. Auto power off when I turn off my gaming system. NO dead pixels. Lightweight. Nice remote. VERY low power consumption. My next TV will be another Sceptre.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfactory.
Reviews.Author: M. Gallaher
Reviews.Content: We're quite pleased with this purchase, so far!  (It's been about a month.)  Easy to set up, good picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Lamin Saidywan
